values: Is anyone else watching The Sing-Off? Know of any LJ communities for the show or the songs from it?

I had the "fortunate accident" of frozen pixels on my iPod Touch (2nd generation), which ended up getting me a brand-new 4th generation thanks to my extended warranty.  I've been learning about the new features since the swap-out a few weeks ago, but I'm wondering if anyone knows of any unusual or hidden tips and tricks :)
I know that I've been quite absent, but I want to wish a happy new year and give hope for a happy 2010!

Anybody know much about fixing a wireless connection?  My router stopped delivering a wireless signal a while before my old pc died, and I finally pulled it out to try to get it working again so I can actually get this laptop on wireless...but now I can't even get a *wired* connection thru it :(  Stupid router is barely 9 months old - think Linksys will still give free support?

...after months without a computer at home that worked, I finally broke down and bought a new one -- a laptop this time!  I'm still in the process of getting things moved off my old dead pc and programs reloaded, but I finally remembered the pw for this LJ and decided to check it out :)

I really never realized how much I missed being online until I could only sneak on at work, and I didn't do that much as I've only been working there since August, and nobody wants to jeopardize a job in this economy.

so what big things have I missed in your lives?

ok, I know I've been away for a long time, and completely out of touch with all things LJ since the Spring, but what did I miss this week?  It looks like all heck is breaking loose and making everyone want to leave LJ...was there a starting point that I can go to when I have some time tomorrow to see where this began?  or a good summary?

oh, and hi, yes, I'm still alive, just swallowed whole by my job!  I love the company where I work, but I'm trying to get back to having a life again ;)

...I have much to be thankful for, and not just a little anxiety (both good and bad) for 2007. The world around me keeps spinning, bringing happiness and stress and accomplishment and worry, all packaged up with a messy bow that keeps us wondering what is next. Many of my friends and family have been blessed with good fortune in 2006, which has brought vicarious pleasure to all. My own good fortune was to change jobs to a great company this spring, behind-the-scenes politics aside. All I really want is a calmer 2007 ;) and I want to wish the same to all of you too!!

oy, I need to be asleep, but I just had to do a Firefox restore and wanted to post a "MIA-wants-to-come-back" request ;)  I haven't been able to post or read for about 10 days, so please let me know what I've missed!

I'm hoping to get a bit of online time this weekend to catch up on two weeks of bookmarks and as much of skip=infinity as possible...

so while I was distracted, I evidently messed up and didn't record several shows the past few days. I missed Gilmore Girls and Supernatural on Tuesday 2/7, as well as Bones on 2/8 (and somehow managed to tape over my Bones 1/25 episode in the process). I'd like to find these episodes online, but when I've tried to use bittorent in the past, I've not been successful in getting a file that will actually open and play...if I'm even getting the right file. so let's pretend that I am starting from no knowledge except that bittorent exists -- what are the steps to get a file that I can watch on my computer?

I got the postcard :)  I'd forgotten that you were sending it, so what a wonderful surprise it was!!!  I wish I had a scanner so I could share this image of Hugh with everyone ;D

[it actually got here the end of last week, but the postal barcode sticker stuck it to the bottom of another piece of mail that I didn't open until tonite...]

I found out that am being forced to buy a new cell phone b/c I was sold the "wrong" kind three years ago, and now they are tearing down all of the TDMA towers so my perfectly-good phone won't work after this month (and it's barely "worked" for the past two months).  The new phone that I picked came in last week and even though it's the same manufacturer (Motorola), it doesn't have any of the ringtones that came pre-programmed on my old phone :(

How would I go about finding these ringtones (from the old Motorola V60 series) to can download to the current Motorola GSM flip-phones?  I've gotten used to the different rings I use for calls, messages, etc for the past three years and want to keep them if I can.

Or if I can't find these exact ringtones, where can I find **free** ringtones that won't cost me a d/l or monthly fee?  I've never used anything like this before, so I'm clueless where to start (or even how to get/load the ringtone if I do find it) -- would someone help me please?

So my RL best friend has finally gotten into reading the HP books and watching the movies...and she knows that I love the books, so we've been discussing them as she reads them and watching the dvds together. She's halfway thru OOTP now, so I asked her if she saw anything about Harry's year 5 Christmas gifts that she wanted to discuss, and the only thing she mentioned was asking if the broom from Tonks was really like his real one. I made the mistake of mentioning that some people online think that JKR's decision to have Remus and Sirius give a gift together was significant...and she made a face that had my heart sinking faster than the Titanic :( I hate that so few of my RL friends are open to accept people being different (it took *forever* to find someone to go with to BBM), especially since so many of my RL friends are already part of a religious minority. I'm so glad to have LJ where people are more willing to accept differences, so I wanted to say a big THANK YOU that all of you are out there!

I finally gave in and installed Firefox b/c Netscape was still giving me grief, and I just couldn't stand to use IE for one more day. So now I'm asking all of you to please pass along any tips (or warnings of what *not* to try) that I might want to know to make this transition smooth and to take greatest advantage of Firefox's expanded capabilities.

I have noticed all day today that I cannot connect to any LJ website using my preferred Netscape browser, whether logged in or not. [error = timeout while trying to contact www.livejournal.com]  

I haven't made any firewall or software changes since last viewing an LJ webpage.  I verified that LJ was back up by pulling up a few webpages in Internet Explorer (using it now to post this!), but I don't often use that browser due to instability.  Did the server change-over this weekend do anything that would make this happen?

I filed a support request, but I was hoping that one of you might also know how to help...  I've been horribly lax at reading/responding for a while and now that I actually had time to do it today, I couldn't do it! argh :( :(

anyway, off to a screening of Rent :)

so I figured out that the software on my old computer that I thought was a Bit Torrent program, well, isn't... and that's why none of the downloads I've tried have worked. now I have no idea which of the multitude of BT programs to choose. I can't even say that I fully understand what to do with it, so I'm looking for one that is user-friendly, no spyware, but it doesn't need lots of bells and whistles. (I use XP and dsl if that makes a difference.) do any of you have any suggested programs and/or FAQ sites to help me please?

...so I was rudely awakened almost two hours ago by some loud noise (just discovered it was the trash guys coming a day late and trying to make up time in the dark!) and had a song running thru my head when it happened.  I thought at first I must have been listening to some sarah mclachlan tunes last night, but I checked on windows media player and none of her songs have played all week, so I'm thinking and thinking and ow, it's too early to be thinking...

anyway, the singer sounded like sarah mclachlan and the lyrics that I remember included "am I in heaven" but I know the next line was *not* "or am I in hell" like in "hold on"<strike>; there was another line later that seemed lifted from another sarah mcl song but I can't remember it now. I figured out that the song in my head was the background music of the last scene of some show I've watched in the past week or so.  I remember thinking that I should write down the lyrics that I could decipher behind the dialog, but I guess I forgot and have since deleted whatever it was off of my dvr :(

does anyone have any idea what show or song this was?  I tried searching but I keep getting "hold on" lyrics or news of the placement of "fallen" on last week's "cold case" -- I can't remember much except that this was the last or next to last scene of the show (possibly "close to home"?), and the song played louder at the beginning and end of the scene to 'frame' the dialog.</strike>

err, so I<strike>'m stupid</strike> was more tired than I thought...it was "hold on" and it was at the end of "crossing jordan"; the show just muted/edited parts of the song, so I only heard a part of the song that I didn't remember as well.

and I have to apologize for going awol for the past month or so -- I haven't stopped reading, but I've constantly been at skip=300 or more trying to catch up, as my lj reading time comes in very short spurts lately.

Has anyone ever used Costco gas?  I remember hearing not-so-good things about the gas that Sams Club sells, but I don't know anyone who uses Costco gas.

Since gas seems to have jumped about 20 cents (for gas that the stations purchased *before* the shortages/price hikes predicted post-Katrina) today, I'm thinking of getting a Costco membership just to save 10 cents a gallon, but I'd love if anyone has feedback for me first...

I am now the proud owner of a tub of Burt's Bees Almond Milk Beeswax Hand Creme, and I have decided that it is the smell of *bliss* :)  

I stumbled into a Burt's Bees demonstration at my favourite farmers market last year and walked away with a large bag of small and sample size products, none of which really won me over, but I got to try a product that wasn't in our bags, and simply fell in love.  and this weekend, I found out that Bath and Body Works now sells it!  so off I went to use part of a store credit...I had to stop myself at one small tub or I might have spent the whole card as this product is not expensive.

I wonder if the blissful calm this scent triggers is actually a sense memory, as it is a very strong feeling.

...so what scents trigger this for you?

I was surfing to find out who did a cover version to a really old song that I love (nope, not gonna admit that I like PP&M, even though I do ;), and I came across a website that is offering 50 free mp3s during a two-week trial offer. Since they require a credit card for the trial, I'm a little wary, but if this is legit, it's a great way to try out a new service...anyone know anything about this website?

...link to me here, but NO SPOILERS, please!!!!!!!!! RL kicked me in the arse this week, so I'm *still* only half-way thru HBP at this point. I have felt so completely disconnected from y'all by being away from LJ for so long, but it couldn't be avoided. I'm hoping to finish reading tomorrow, but I have no illusions that I'll like the second half much better than the first half at this point.

...I'm not liking it as much as I wanted to, so far. Have I read too much fic, so much so that canon doesn't ring true now? HBP kind of reads like fan fiction...and not even like my favourite stories. JKR throws in everything you wouldn't expect in the first two chapters, so much so that I had to re-read them before going on to chapter 3. then it later becomes blatantly obvious that JKR read web chatter, as she proceeds to answer many of our question outright (Katie is a 7th year student now), but glosses over other details that we (read: I) would rather know (like what is happening with Remus). She's hinting at shipping (did Hermione kiss Krum? what would happen to Harry if R/Hr happens? does Harry like Ginny?) in places, then smushes our faces in it in others (just read the Ron/Lav at the party scene). I'm not racing to finish, except in that I want to be sure that I don't get spoiled for the second half of the book before I get through it. Huh, I think that that phrasing tells you just how enthused I am about finishing :(

ok, so for a change of pace from the past two days' posts (while inspiring in how much everyone cares for each other, I just needed something to balance), I went looking for some good news on random sites...and found out here that MTV and VH1 realized how badly they messed up, so they will re-air 10 hours of Live 8 coverage tomorrow. "The 10-hour block of Live 8 performances will kick off at 10 a.m. ET Saturday on VH1 and shift to MTV at 3 p.m. Both networks will feature the likes of U2, Coldplay, Pink Floyd and Paul McCartney, but otherwise the coverage will be targeted to each channel's audience. VH1 will showcase songs by Rob Thomas, Sting and the Dave Matthews Band, while MTV will focus on the likes of Green Day, the Killers, Kanye West and Jay-Z." I suspect we still might not see some of the best performances, but at least it'll be better than last week's US coverage! so even though I got blocked into my driveway by a tow-truck and had to miss going to synagogue tonight, I still found something to make me feel good...too bad I'll be out in the hot sun the entire time this is on -- hope I have some blank videotape!

I watched about 20-30 minutes, but when the commercials lasted longer than the roving interviews which lasted longer than the performances, I turned it off :(

I can't get the online coverage at AOL music to work, not on Netscape or on IE; has anyone?

I wish I had XM satellite radio coverage

Live 8: Hyde Park running order
The centrepiece of Live 8 day is the star-studded concert to be held in London's Hyde Park.

The official running order was revealed by the organisers shortly before the concert kicked off at 1400 BST. By the early stages the concert was already running off schedule.

yes, I do mean a *cracked* nose...the skin on the front of my nose has cracked from the effects of this cold :( this morning when I went to wash my face, I saw a huge scab forming just above my nostil -- ow! if I blow my nose too much, the skin often gets raw and red, but this time it actually split! I'm afraid to use anything like neosporin (or maybe the neosporin lip balm?) unless someone tells me it's ok to do that...can't get the pharmacist or my mom on the phone right now, so I'm hoping some of you might be able to help me fix this. anyone got a home remedy?

Does anyone know if the woman sitting next to Norbert Leo Butz at the Tonys was Michelle Federer?  I've never seen any photos of her except in her Wicked costumes, so I'm not sure if that's why the woman next to NLB <lj-cut text="cut for Tonys spoiler">when he won his Tony tonite was her...he mentioned her in his speech, and the woman </lj-cut> looked familiar, so that's why I'm thinking it was Michelle Federer.

...not really hungry, but I like that my mood icon is thinking of strawberries :D I just watched my OC tape from last night (I'm a little hooked on that cutie Adam Brody ;) and saw a commercial for Tru Calling!! There are *finally* showing the 6 episodes that they filmed of season 2 before shutting down production! Does anyone still have the two-hour S1 finale? I never got to see it last spring b/c I had no reception from my satellite that night :( I'd really love to get to see that finale before the new season starts...if anyone can dub it (cheaply but good quality), I can reimburse for the tape using Paypal. I had tried to d/l it via bittorent, but the software to watch the file corrupted my PC, so that wasn't an option for me.

Is there anyone out there who understands hardware glitches? I can fix software stuff on my own, but hardware kind of mystifies me... I think my computer has somehow "forgotten" that it has cd and dvd drives...I suspected this was the case earlier this week when I couldn't get Windows Media Player to play a cd someone loaned me, but I was too tired to investigate it that night. Now I'm sure this is the case -- I went into Windows Explorer and it won't list my D or E drives, and another software that I tried told me "no CD drive found"!! When I put a cd in, it starts to make the "I'm reading the disc" whirring noise for less than a second, but then stops. Rebooting won't make a difference, as I've shut down several times since this problem first surfaced. I can't bear to think of losing all my data that I foolishly haven't backed up, but now can't since I have no working CD-RW drive... This computer is only 7 months old, it can't be this broken already :( ETA: after over an hour with Tech Support, we think that is has to do with the drivers for these drives somehow getting corrupted...he wants me to do a System Restore to a month ago. What will I lose if I do this? And I now think it may have been caused by installing Nero software, since the restore date is right before I installed this; does anyone know of another software that I can get free that will assist me with burning cds (both audio and data), as well as possibly printing cd covers? ETA 2: I officially dislike my computer -- now my firewall and internet connection are acting up and I've having to use a verrrrrrrrrry old computer to post now :( Can I start today over again please?

A legitimate email list that I'm on sent me an offer to get two free audio books, so I'm asking all of you for suggestions. I don't have to make my decision right away, so I've been trying to sort through their listings of hundreds upon hundreds of titles. Alas, no HP, but DaVinci Code caught my eye...anyone read it yet? If so, do you think it will translate well to audio? Feel free to pimp out this question -- I can use all the advice I can get! Oh, and if anyone else wants info on this offer, drop me an email and I'll give you the details!

huh...I just came back to the computer (usually just put it in sleep mode if I'll be away more than an hour, and this time was over 6 hours) and refreshed my flist -- and my entire LJ style has changed!!  The style and the colours are completely different.  I have no idea which stylename I used to use, just that it was S2, and I had modified the colours on whatever style I had set.

Did free users lose some of their choices of S2 styles today?  How would I even go about asking LJ to "look up" what my settings used to be?

Happy Birthday !!!

We February babies have to stick together -- there may be fewer of us, but I think our quality makes up for what we lack in quantity ;)

Hope you had a great day!

...and this time it had nothing to do with HP at all. I was trying to finish reading my f'list and get to sleep, all with the TV on behind me. I could hear the musical guest on "Last Call" sounded Reggae/Jamaican, and I was curious what he looked like. I turned around and saw *not at all* what I expected: Matisyahu is a Hasidic Jew, in full beard/payos/Black coat/Black Hat, and I think I even saw tzitzit! How have I never heard of him before? He sounds quite authentically Reggae (to me), and he was dancing around like I've only seen when I peeked around a mechitza on an especially rambunctious Shabbos. I couldn't believe how many kids in the crowd were obviously MOT, many of the boys had kippot, girls in long sleeves/long skirts :) I did a quick Google search to learn more since his website seems to be overloaded, and I figured out why his eyes looked unfocused -- he takes off his glasses when performing to avoid seeing immodestly-dressed women. If I was Hasidic, I might just be in love with this guy based on this level of respect. ...and to anyone who has no idea whatsoever what most of this meant, let me know and I'll "translate" the words you don't know ;D

SNL had several of the muppets (Kermit, Animal, Fozzie, and Gonzo -- how scary is it that I still know all the names?!?!?) help out Horatio Sanz with his annual Xmas song that he used to do with Jimmy Fallon, Chris Kattan and (I think) Tracy Morgan, each of whom have left the show.

::runs off to squee at a childhood favorite muppet::

So I did my *third* Locks of Love donation last week, and I'm still getting used to it. I'll probably have my friend who owns her own salon "fix" this mistake of a free haircut, b/c I specifically told the idiot stylist that I did not want a blunt cut, but except for a small bit of layering that the idiot stylist started to do before cutting her own hand, it's a blunt cut ;p I'm hoping that this upload works: one last braid it was down to my waist! this is what almost 12 inches of cut hair looks like... the end result -- but it's not curly, it's frizzy! Without posting a picture of my face, can anyone suggest a good style? I don't want to cut more than another inch or so at the most, but I hate the layers that have been cut in so far... ETA - woohoo, I got the pictures resized and everything...go me!! (It's after 2am, so my computer skills are probably a little impaired at this point ;) Here's hoping that I have good dreams when I finally fall asleep, influenced by reading tonite ;D | ETA 2 -- I forgot to post, I'm walking again :) thanks to everyone who asked/sent good wishes! Physical therapy is going well, and I'm hoping for a decent settlement from the store where this happened...the ER bills alone were nearly $1000! | | ETA 3 --- some guy just rang my doorbell twice, and it's 2:53 am!!! Since this is the third time it's happened in about a month, I actually yelled out "how is it?" from the safety of my bedroom, only to hear an unfamiliar name and voice...oh crap! so I just yelled back that he had the wrong house and I saw him walk away, and not just over to my next door neighbor...wish I'd been awake enough to see a better description, but hopefully that will be a moot point.

...that I'm about to lose ownership over, that is. I have an appointment in less than 8 hours to do my third Locks of Love hair donation. I don't know anything at all about this salon where I'm going except from their website, and I think that is what is freaking me out a little. The first donation was just random stylists hired by Clairol for a nationwide hair drive. The second donation was at a chic salon in the "popular" part of town. But this time, I couldn't find any salons willing to give me a real style after the blunt cut, so I searched the locksoflove.org website to find one. The one I found is pretty far from my house, and I'm a little put off by some of the things the owner put on the salon website, but that's just b/c I think we have some differing opinions on some things that are completely non-hair-related. I have no idea how I want it styled after the blunt cut is done -- I'm not even sure yet if I'm donating just the minimum 10 inches or going up to 12 inches, so I can't tell how short it's going to get. I hope that I picked a good stylist. I hope she can help me find a style I like as much as the last salon gave me. It sucks that my old stylist isn't allowed by the owners of his new salon to cut hair anymore; he can only do colour now :( I would have gone back to him in a heartbeat. I think I've just gotten so used to my long hair this time b/c I waited longer between donations this time (14 months from cut #1 to cut #2, but 34 months since cut #2 until now) because I kept it medium-ish length for almost a year after cut #2. Except for these donations, I've had long hair nearly my whole life...I only cut it short voluntarily once, when I was graduating college, and that was mostly b/c I was trying to cut off horrible layers. The one good thing about *that* cut was that my hair was naturally wavy for the first time ever. Of course that was the shortest it had been since I was 2 years old, so it was much less heavy than before I cut off the layers! (I have very thick hair.) I wonder if it will curl again this time; I really hope so, but that was over 10 years ago, and I'm sure my hair's "personality" has changed since then. Every time I've donated, I've had at least one friend go with me to "hold my hand in case I cry," but it's really to hold me there so I don't try to run away at the last second! I think we'll have a digital camera to take before/after pics; if they come out decent, I'll finally make myself learn how to upload pics from my computer to the web. ...I already miss my hair, but I know I'm doing a wonderful thing by donating it.

I hate my ankles.   No, not how they look, although that could be improved, but that they aren't strong.  I was at a grocery store yesterday, and just as I finished, I slipped on a big puddle of what looked like melted chocolate ice cream...in the *produce* section!!  First of all, who was the idiot who opened whatever melted on the floor...and why in produce?!?!

I proceeded to spend the next four-plus hours with incompetent EMS who somehow forgot to let the ER know I was there, a fairly rude ER person, and some majorly brown-nosing personnel from the store where I fell.  The store people seemed to be sorry that it happened and even helped me get my car home since I couldn't drive after the *wonderful* meds the ER gave me, but now I can't work the rest of the week since my current job involves being on my feet 100% of the time and that isn't possible until I get off my crutches.

Maybe I should try to get some interviews for permanent jobs in my real occupation... the sympathy vote might get me a second interview!  I just have to remember not to take any pain meds beforehand LOL

Might someone point me to some new trio or R/Hr fic to ease my pain please?  :)

hmmm...I finally decided that I would get a LJ, but now I can't think of what to write in my first post.  I found LJ kind of by accident a few months ago, when a HP fanfic writer mentioned hers in a group email, and it kind of exploded from there ;)   I never knew there was so much out there!  

So I figured I wouldn't lurk anonymously anymore, and finally signed up today...it seemed like a good way to break up the day in between rejection calls/emails from head-hunters!  

I feel like I should write a gripping intro post, but everything I thought of just fell flat.  And since I mostly have used LJ (so far) to read fic writers' journals,  I just want to say thank you to the talented writers who distract and entertain me with their fantastic stories :)  and even with tales of their not-so-boring real lives too -- reading about your RL stuff makes me feel more normal ;)



*and no, I don't think of myself as single-celled; "amoeba" was an accidental nickname that I acquired long ago but don't really use anymore, so I figured it was a "safe" anonymous name to use*
